intro: Ebraxis behen, commonly known as the Indian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to South Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers and slender, creeping stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and wetlands. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
